1.SceneDescription:
Central Perk, the whole gang is there, Ross is telling a story about what
happened at work and the rest of the gang are thinking to themselves, denoted by italics.

lines.Line:
So I told Carl, ‘Nobody, no matter how famous their parents are,
nobody is allowed to climb on the dinosaur.’ But of course this went in one ear and
out....

<i>I love how he cares so much about stuff. If I squint I can pretend
he’s Alan Alda.</i
<i>Oh good, another dinosaur story. When are those gonna become extinct?</i

<i>If I was a superhero who could fly and be invisible, that
would be the best.</i

<i>What does Rachel see in this guy? I love Rachel. I wish she was my
wife.</i

<i>What does Rachel see in this guy? I love Rachel. I wish she was my
wife.</i
Joey is singing in his head.

2.SceneDescription: Central Perk, Rachel is on the phone, everyone else is there except Joey.

lines.Line:
‘Okay. (listens) Okay, daddy we’ll see you tomorrow night.
(listens) Okay bye-bye.’ (hangs up

Are ah, having dinner with my Dad tomorrow night, I hope that’s
okay

Oh shoot, tomorrow’s not so good, I’m supposed to um, fall off
the Empire State building and land on a bicycle with no seat. Sorry
Ross, my father doesn’t hate you
Ross, my father doesn’t hate you
Please, he refers to me as ‘wethead’

But honey he calls everybody by a nickname! Okay, look, I know, all
right, just one dinner, please, just one night for me, please. I just want him to love you
like I do. (Ross looks at her) All right, well not exactly like I do, but, but, if you do
come to dinner, I’ll love you like I do in that black thing that you like

See, that’s why I could never be an actor. Because I can’t
say gig
Yeah, I can’t say croissant. (realises) Oh my God

Well, it’s not a part, no. I’m teaching acting for soap operas
down at the Learning Extension

Yeah, yeah. It’s like my chance to give something back to the acting
community
Y’know your probably not allowed to sleep with any of your students

3.SceneDescription:
Classroom. Joey is writing his name on the board, but turns around before
he’s done which causes him to write his name with a downward curve, and he then
underlines it, and draws the line right through his name.

lines.Line: Good evening. I’m Mr. Tribbiani. And I will be teaching acting for soap operas. Now um, on my first day as (proudly) Dr. Drake Remoray on Days of Our Lives, (looks for a reaction from his students, and gets none.) I learned that one of the most important things in soap opera acting is reacting, this does not mean acting again, it means, you don’t have a line, but someone else just did. And it goes like this. (looks all intense for a moment and then gasps, the students cheer him) Thanks, thanks, a lot. Oh, by the way, before I forget to work in soap operas some of you will have to become much more attractive. All right, moving right along

4.SceneDescription: Restaurant, Rachel and Ross and Dr. Green are having dinner.

lines.Line:
This where they put it? What, there no table available in the
kitchen! Hello, baby
Nice to see you again Dr. Green.

So! (they both try to sit next to Rachel but Dr. Green is
successful.) (to Ross) How’s the library

There never was a library. I mean there are libraries, its just that I ah,
I never worked at one

You know what’s really good here, the lobster. What do you say
shall I just order three

Yeah, if you’re really hungry. (Dr. Green stares at him) It was a
joke, I made a joke
Yeah, actually Daddy Ross is allergic to lobster
Yeah, actually Daddy Ross is allergic to lobster

What kind of person is allergic to lobster? I guess the kind of
person that works at a library

(interrupting him) I know!! It’s a museum! What, you’re the
only one around here who can make a joke! At least mine was funny. Ah, waiter, we will
have two lobsters and a menu. (nods at Ross, and mouths I don’t know to the waiter.

5.SceneDescription: Classroom, Joey is lecturing on facial expressions.

lines.Line:
Okay, some tricks of the trade. Now, I’ve never been able to cry as
an actor, so if I’m in a scene where I have to cry, I cut a hole in my pocket, take a
pair of tweezers, and just start pulling. Or ah, or, let’s say I wanna convey that
I’ve just done something evil. That would be the basic ‘I have a fishhook in my
eyebrow and I like it’ (Does it by raising one eyebrow, and showing off the pretend
fishhook.) Okay, let’s say I’ve just gotten bad news, well all I do there is try
and divide 232 by 13. (looks all confused) And that’s how it’s done. Great soap
opera acting tonight everybody, class dismissed
Guess what, I got an audition
Awww, one of my students got an audition. I’m so proud
I was wondering if you would consider coaching me for it
I was wondering if you would consider coaching me for it
Oh it’s great, it’s a role on All My Children, Nick the boxer

6.SceneDescription: Monica’s bedroom, Phoebe is trying to hide the bed from Monica.

lines.Line: This is not the bed I ordered
This is not the bed I ordered
I know, you must’ve won like a contest or something!

lines.Character: (Phoebe starts to make a sound like a car acceleratin
lines.Line: Phoebe starts to make a sound like a car accelerating

lines.Character: (Phoebe makes a sound like a car screeching to a halt
lines.Line: Phoebe makes a sound like a car screeching to a halt.
Why is this car in my bedroom

I’m sorry, okay, I-I wasn’t looking, and the store says that
they won’t take it back because you signed for it..
When did I sign for it
When did I sign for it
When did I sign for it

When I was you! Y'know what, it’s all Joey’s fault,
‘cause he left his nose open
(to Phoebe) Quick, take off your dress, he won’t notice the bed

Hey, I’m going for sushi does anybody want.. (enters and sees the
bed) Whoa-whoa, somebody missed the off ramp

So. This has always been Monica’s bed, what you’re just
noticing now, how self-involved are you

Okay, well it this bed isn’t new, how come there is plastic on
the mattress

Sometimes I have bad dreams. (starts to break down, and Phoebe offers
her, her hand to comfort her.

7.SceneDescription: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are there, yelling at Joey.

lines.Line: You told him to play the boxer gay!
Joey, you’re this guy’s teacher. I mean how could you do this

Because, Monica, the guy’s so good, and I really, really want this
part
Well, if you really, really want it, then it’s okay
Well, if you really, really want it, then it’s okay

8.SceneDescription: Classroom, Joey is talking to his students.

lines.Line:
(sadly) There will come a time in each of your careers when you’ll
have a chance to screw over another soap opera actor. I had such an opportunity in the
recent, present. And I’m ashamed to say that I took it, I advised a fellow actor to
play a role, homosexually. Yeah, we both auditioned for the part, and uh, as it turned
out, they ah, they liked the stupid gay thing and cast him. And now, he’s got a two
year contract opposite Susan Luchhi, the first lady of daytime television, and me, me
I’m stuck here teaching a bunch of people, most of whom are too ugly to even be on
TV. I’m sorry, I’m sorry, I’m sorry. (he gets a huge round of applause from
his students.) Thank you

9.SceneDescription: Monica’s bedroom, Chandler is playing with the bed.

lines.Line:
Varrrrrroom! Hey! Watch it lady! Varrrrrrrrrrom! (makes a screeching
sound as he pretends to stomp on the brakes.) Hey-hey good lookin’! (honks the
bed’s little horn on the steering wheel.) Varrrrrrrrroom. (notices Rachel and stops)
All right, I’ll leave. My bed’s so boring
